metadata.title: CVE-2024-36041 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium
metadata.description:
KSmserver in KDE Plasma Workspace (aka plasma-workspace) before 5.27.11.1and 6.x before 6.0.5.1 allows connections via ICE based purely on the host,i.e., all local connections are accepted. This allows another user on thesame machine to gain access to the session manager, e.g., use thesession-restore feature to execute arbitrary code as the victim (on thenext boot) via earlier use of the /tmp directory.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-36041` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libcolorcorrect5 - 4:5.27.8-0ubuntu1.1
libkfontinst5 - 4:5.27.8-0ubuntu1.1
libkfontinstui5 - 4:5.27.8-0ubuntu1.1
libkworkspace5-5 - 4:5.27.8-0ubuntu1.1
libnotificationmanager1 - 4:5.27.8-0ubuntu1.1
libplasma-geolocation-interface5 - 4:5.27.8-0ubuntu1.1
libtaskmanager6 - 4:5.27.8-0ubuntu1.1
libweather-ion7 - 4:5.27.8-0ubuntu1.1
plasma-workspace - 4:5.27.8-0ubuntu1.1
plasma-workspace-data - 4:5.27.8-0ubuntu1.1
plasma-workspace-wayland - 4:5.27.8-0ubuntu1.1
sddm-theme-breeze - 4:5.27.8-0ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: plasma-workspace package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4:5.27.8-0ubuntu1.1').
